ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Chronic Otitis Media with Tympanic Membrane Perforation
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of childhood perforation and failed surgery, intermittent otorrhea, and Type B tympanogram with large ear canal volume.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Conductive Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant air-bone gap in the left ear consistent with tympanic membrane perforation and potential ossicular chain involvement.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess degree and type of hearing loss given history of perforation.
Evaluate speech reception and recognition abilities.
Assess middle ear status and confirm perforation (canal volume).
Evaluate integrity of the reflex arc.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with normal hearing in the right ear and a moderately severe to moderate conductive hearing loss in the left ear. Tympanometry in the left ear reveals a flat trace with a large ear canal volume, confirming the presence of a patent tympanic membrane perforation. Acoustic reflexes are absent bilaterally.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear normal (0-10 dB HL). Left ear moderately severe to moderate conductive loss (250-500 Hz ~55 dB HL, improving to 35-40 dB HL at higher frequencies) with normal bone conduction.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear SRT 13 dB HL, WRS 100%. Left ear SRT 40 dB HL, WRS 100%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear Type A (normal). Left ear Type B (flat) with large ear canal volume (7.1 mL), consistent with perforation.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent for both ipsilateral and contralateral stimulation in both ears at all frequencies (500-4000 Hz).

proposed_items: Referral to ENT specialist for consultation
Imaging studies to determine viability of surgical repair
Revision tympanoplasty with possible ossicular chain reconstruction
Hearing aid trial (if surgery is declined or unsuccessful)
counseling_actions: Advise on water precautions to keep the left ear dry

escalation.rationale_short: Evaluation of chronic tympanic membrane perforation with active symptoms (otorrhea, otalgia) for potential surgical repair.

follow_up_plan.timeline: Following ENT consultation and potential surgery
follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor healing of the tympanic membrane and assess post-operative hearing status.
